channel.title: Connection Error
channel.description:
I have a problem on my server, its very annoying, and it affects everyone on it. :mad:
I run my server 24/7 on my computer, with the occasional restart of the computer. But, I have a major bug in my server.
Whenever I run the server, people start connecting, and usually after a minute or two, I get this error..
[CODE]Unable to start port listener on port 43594 - Make sure port isn't in use.[/CODE]
It's not exactly like that, but something like that. Anyway, I know what the error means! I'm not an idiot, I've been using private server for almost a year now, and I know a lot about the private servers.
I don't run anything else on the computer that run on that port. On average, I'm usually running:
Firefox Smart FTP MSN iTunes Private Server w/ Auto Restarter
That's about it. I know none of those programs are taking up the port of 43594. I even tried other ports, but to no avail.
I'm guessing it has something to do with my auto restarter, but maybe not.
When I get this error..
[CODE]Unable to start port listener on port 43594 - Make sure port isn't in use.[/CODE]
People are still playing on the server! But, if someone would happen to log off and try to get in, it wouldn't allow them to.
So I set my auto restarter to about 10 minutes because of this. But that usually creates a problem. When my restarter kicks everyone out, sometimes the error comes back immediately, not letting anyone log in for the next 10 minutes.
I think that's all the information I need to let you guys know about. If I forgot something, or if you have any questions, just post them here, and I'll reply ASAP.
Thanks! ;)

item.title: Connection Error
item.dc:creator: @Byty Byty
item.description:
@Byty wrote:

I did all that, I’ve been running my server on the same computer for months now.

I have tried changing the ports and everything, but nothing seems to work.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 04, 2007, 07:14:51 PM[/size][hr]I need to bump this…

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error
item.dc:creator: @zezimaisme111 zezimaisme111
item.description:
@zezimaisme111 wrote:

try and close em
or try and change the port to 5555
(in server.java) and you will need to prtforward again

or check your exceptions tab in your firewall, make sure nothing else is 43594 port

Read full topic

item.title: Connection Error

item.description:
@Byty wrote:

I have a problem on my server, its very annoying, and it affects everyone on it. :mad:

I run my server 24/7 on my computer, with the occasional restart of the computer. But, I have a major bug in my server.

Whenever I run the server, people start connecting, and usually after a minute or two, I get this error…

It’s not exactly like that, but something like that. Anyway, I know what the error means! I’m not an idiot, I’ve been using private server for almost a year now, and I know a lot about the private servers.

I don’t run anything else on the computer that run on that port. On average, I’m usually running:

MSN
iTunes
Private Server w/ Auto Restarter

That’s about it. I know none of those programs are taking up the port of 43594. I even tried other ports, but to no avail.

I’m guessing it has something to do with my auto restarter, but maybe not.

I think that’s all the information I need to let you guys know about. If I forgot something, or if you have any questions, just post them here, and I’ll reply ASAP.

Thanks!
